page.title: 03The River Rother.
page.content: The River Rother begins in central East Sussex and reaches the sea{34 {miles}from its source.The river flows through Rye and {enters the sea at Rye {Bay. }On the east side of the river is Rye Golf Club and Camber Road whilst on the west side is the village of Rye Harbour.The dunes on the east bank are the highest points of Romney Marsh. {A fishing fleet of 20_30 boats} sails the River Rother at high tide.Fishing takes place 8 miles out in Rye Bay where whiting, Dover sole and plaice are the main fish caught. Fairly large {cargo ships}(up to 1300 tons )unload at the timber wharf,Rye Harbour.In 1984 a seal (which we called Sammy)swam into the river,it stayed there for a few weeks then it disappeared.{ { *****************************
